Ingredients:
 1. Butter - 60 gm
 2. Onion, finely chopped - 1 PCS
 3. Crushed garlic - 2 cloves
 4. Smoked ham, diced - 50 gm
 5. Ground beef - 500 gm
 6. Chopped oregano - 1 tbsp
 7. Tomato paste - 2 tbsp
 8. Tomatoes, diced - 800 gm
 9. Salt, pepper
 10. Spaghetti - 400 gm
 11. Grated cheese (preferably Parmesan) - 3 tbsp

Recipe:
 Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic. Cook over low heat, stirring, for 5 minutes. Increase the heat to high, add the ham, ground beef, and oregano. Cook for 4-5 minutes.
 Add the tomato paste, tomato pulp, salt, and pepper. Cover the sauce and simmer for 1.5 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove the lid and cook the sauce for another hour, stirring occasionally.
 Cook the spaghetti in salted water until al dente (just undercooked). Drain in a colander and return to the pot, keeping the spaghetti warm.
 Pour the Bolognese sauce over the spaghetti. Serve spaghetti bolognese with Parmesan.

Ingredients:
 1. Chicken fillet - 300 gm
 2. Eggs - 4 PCS
 3. Hard cheese - 200 gm
 4. Cherry tomatoes - 200 gm
 5. Croutons - 40 gm
 6. Lettuce leaves - 200 gm
 7. Salt, pepper
 8. Olive oil - 100 ml
 9. Juice of 0.5 lemon
 10. Mustard - 2 tbsp
 11. Crushed garlic - 2 cloves

Ingredients:
 1. Eggs - 3 PCS
 2. Milk (warm) - 700 ml
 3. Sugar - 1 tbsp
 4. Salt - 1 tsp
 5. Flour - 7 tbsp (heaped)
 6. Baking soda - 0.5 tsp (quench with vinegar)
 7. Vegetable oil - 2 tbsp

Recipe:
 Crack the eggs into a bowl, add warm milk, salt, sugar, vegetable oil, and baking soda mixed with vinegar. Beat well with a whisk or fork.
 Sift the flour. Add one tablespoon at a time. Beat well to avoid lumps.
 Preheat the frying pan. Cook the crepes in a dry, hot frying pan, greasing it only before the first crepes. Bake until golden brown on one side, then the other.
